name: GitHub
description: Automate workflows, manage repositories, and integrate CI/CD pipelines with forAgents.dev kits.
setupInstructions: To integrate GitHub with your AI agent, you'll need to create a personal access token and configure the API client.
steps: Go to GitHub Settings ‚Üí Developer settings ‚Üí Personal access tokens
Click 'Generate new token' and select required scopes (repo, workflow, admin:org)
Copy the generated token and store it securely
Configure your agent with the token using environment variables
Test the connection by making a simple API call

name: VS Code
description: Build extensions and integrate agent capabilities directly into your development environment.
setupInstructions: Create a VS Code extension that connects to your AI agent through the Extension API.
steps: Install Yeoman and VS Code Extension Generator: npm install -g yo generator-code
Generate extension scaffold: yo code
Implement extension activation and command handlers
Connect to your AI agent API
Package and publish extension to VS Code Marketplace

name: Slack
description: Send notifications, create interactive workflows, and build custom bot integrations.
setupInstructions: Configure a Slack app with bot permissions and webhook URLs to enable agent communication.
steps: Create a new Slack app at api.slack.com/apps
Enable 'Incoming Webhooks' and add webhook to workspace
Configure bot token scopes (chat:write, channels:read, etc.)
Install app to your workspace
Copy the webhook URL and bot token to your environment

name: Discord
description: Create bots, automate server management, and build community engagement tools.
setupInstructions: Set up a Discord bot application and connect it to your AI agent for automated interactions.
steps: Create a new application at discord.com/developers/applications
Navigate to the 'Bot' section and click 'Add Bot'
Copy the bot token (keep this secret!)
Enable required Gateway Intents (Server Members, Message Content, etc.)
Generate OAuth2 URL and invite bot to your server

name: Notion
description: Automate documentation, sync data, and create intelligent knowledge management systems.
setupInstructions: Create a Notion integration to allow your AI agent to read and write data to your workspace.
steps: Go to notion.so/my-integrations and create a new integration
Copy the Internal Integration Token
Share target pages/databases with your integration
Use the Notion API to query and update content
Implement error handling and rate limiting

name: Linear
description: Automate issue tracking, sync project data, and streamline development workflows.
setupInstructions: Generate a Linear API key and use GraphQL to manage issues and projects programmatically.
steps: Go to Linear Settings ‚Üí API ‚Üí Personal API Keys
Create a new API key with appropriate scopes
Store the API key securely
Use the GraphQL API to query and mutate data
Implement webhooks for real-time updates (optional)

name: Jira
description: Connect agile workflows, automate ticket management, and integrate with development processes.
setupInstructions: Set up Jira Cloud API authentication and integrate with your AI agent workflows.
steps: Create an API token at id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/security/api-tokens
Get your Jira domain (e.g., yourcompany.atlassian.net)
Use Basic Auth with email and API token
Test connection with a simple API call
Implement issue creation and updates

name: Vercel
description: Deploy applications, manage deployments, and automate CI/CD pipelines seamlessly.
setupInstructions: Generate a Vercel API token to automate deployments and manage projects from your AI agent.
steps: Go to Vercel Account Settings ‚Üí Tokens
Create a new token with appropriate scope
Install the Vercel CLI or use the REST API
Configure your project and team IDs
Trigger deployments programmatically

name: AWS
description: Manage cloud infrastructure, automate deployments, and integrate with AWS services.
setupInstructions: Configure AWS credentials and use the SDK to interact with various AWS services from your agent.
steps: Install AWS CLI: aws --version to verify
Create IAM user with programmatic access
Configure credentials: aws configure
Set up AWS SDK in your application
Test connection with a simple service call

name: Docker
description: Build, deploy, and manage containerized applications with automated workflows.
setupInstructions: Use Docker Engine API or CLI to manage containers programmatically from your AI agent.
steps: Install Docker and ensure daemon is running
Enable Docker API (Unix socket or TCP)
Install Docker SDK for your language
Authenticate if using Docker Hub
Test connection and container operations

name: Kubernetes
description: Orchestrate containers, manage clusters, and automate deployment strategies.
setupInstructions: Configure kubectl and use the Kubernetes API to manage cluster resources from your agent.
steps: Install kubectl CLI tool
Configure kubeconfig file with cluster credentials
Install Kubernetes client library
Test connection: kubectl cluster-info
Implement resource management operations

name: Terraform
description: Automate infrastructure as code, manage cloud resources, and enable GitOps workflows.
setupInstructions: Use Terraform CLI and cloud provider APIs to manage infrastructure programmatically.
steps: Install Terraform CLI
Initialize Terraform configuration directory
Configure cloud provider credentials
Create .tf configuration files
Execute terraform plan and apply via code

name: OpenAI
description: Integrate GPT models, embeddings, and other OpenAI services into your agent workflows.
setupInstructions: Set up OpenAI API access to leverage language models and AI capabilities in your agents.
steps: Create an account at platform.openai.com
Generate an API key from the API keys section
Install the OpenAI SDK: npm install openai
Configure the API key in your environment
Make your first API call to test connectivity

name: Anthropic
description: Integrate Claude AI models for advanced reasoning, analysis, and conversational capabilities.
setupInstructions: Configure Anthropic API access to use Claude models in your AI agent applications.
steps: Sign up at console.anthropic.com
Generate an API key from your account settings
Install the Anthropic SDK: npm install @anthropic-ai/sdk
Set the API key in your environment variables
Test with a simple message to Claude
